tweets.text: Spot the culvert! Blocked culverts can be a #flood risk. Our field teams are regularly out checking and clearing blocked culverts . We are ready for flooding- are you ready to #PrepareActSurvive a flood this winter? https://t.co/hbQAFTlDjW https://t.co/35sn4qXeea

Not to mention 
@CityWestminster 
Concerns about evacuation risk from @EnvAgency 
@LDNGardensTrust 
Concerns about effect on World Heritage Site from @ICOMOSUK 

Have certainly forgotten many more. Please do add these below!
4/4

@TheMontyDon Down our lane this morning, a portaloo lorry decided to discharge his tank onto the verge. Effluent, loo roll, plastic gloves...üò°üò§The effect on people, livestock, wildlife...what IS the matter with people...Just as well I didn‚Äôt catch him at it...

entity.name: Entertainment Tonight
entity.description: Each episode gives viewers an inside look at television, film and music, including interviews with each industry's biggest stars. Over the years, many celebrities have "broken their silence" regarding various scandals or tragedies with hosts and correspondents from "ET." In addition to covering breaking news, the show visits sets of movies and TV shows and heads to the red carpet to cover awards shows and other major events. Airing daily since 1981, "Entertainment Tonight" is the template by which many other entertainment newsmagazines are based.

tweets.text:
It's #FloodActionWeek and also 10yrs since the Nov 2010 floods that affected 300+ properties in Cornwall. Following the floods The EA & @CornwallCouncil created @CwllCFloodForum to help before, during & after a flood. 
Do you know what to do in a flood? https://t.co/4F9BadnblZ https://t.co/oZe6Kg8BsR

Its flood Action week. We‚Äôre encouraging everyone to check their risk and know what to do in a flood. https://t.co/4F9BadnblZ

At the EA we prepare year round building and maintaining flood defences, sometimes underwater, like here at Sutton harbour lock #Plymouth https://t.co/dMUOJp48KJ

Sandbags are an important tool in our incident response. We make sure we are trained and ready to respond to whatever the weather throws at us. Make sure you are too and be ready to #PrepareActSurvive any floods this winter. https://t.co/hbQAFTlDjW https://t.co/iUPPFVUBFv

tweets.text:
Do you know how to survive a flood? Survivalist Megan Hine explains the three things you need to know üëá 

Over 5 million UK homes are at risk of flooding. Don't assume it won't happen to you.

https://t.co/CsUTBjY5Ft 

#FloodActionWeek #PrepareActSurvive

@Meg_Hine https://t.co/Bf3koSXpds

Do you know....
How many homes and businesses are at risk of flooding?
What the average cost of flooding to a home is?
How long it takes, on average, before you can return home?
Know about what to do in a flood. #FloodActionWeek 
@EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgency @itvcalendar https://t.co/0hpEJ4XpMC

@AidanRidyard @severnrivers @CRTWalesandSW @EnvAgencyMids I think you'd have to take that up with architects. I know a lot of time and thought has gone into such a small building.  Especially the logistics of the staircase with challenging building regs in such a tight space.

Beautiful brown trout filmed this week in the #Trent at @StaffsUni. Fish of this size may now be reaching this part of the river because the new channel at the Victoria Ground bypasses two weirs, which were a barrier to fish passage. 
@EnvAgencyMids @CraigBennett3 @WildTroutTrust https://t.co/B65vmWzYs9

This barely alive #carp is from a fishery where so far 60+ similar sized specimens have suffered & died from a susp‚Äô viral infection, our lab will confirm. Possibly from 3 Koi which were illegally dumped into the lake. Please DO-NOT illegally move fish! ‚Å¶@EnvAgencyNW‚Å© plsRT https://t.co/VW4jmB0gIF

tweets.text:
Have you signed up to receive free flood warnings for your local area this #FloodActionWeek?
 
It only takes a minute and could save your life!

More information can be found here üëâ https://t.co/QsAp4chuX6 https://t.co/wipVgnKQzb

Nature watchdog @NaturalEngland is now 
so underfunded it 
- is unable to protect species at risk of extinction
- only does bare legal minimum running national nature reserves
 - lacks capacity to create new protected areas. 
The list goes on. @TonyJuniper to @CommonsEAC letter https://t.co/9Z5n3sCU84

For #FloodActionWeek we‚Äôre asking you to prepare for winter - but we are too! Our flood warning expansion team has added 20000 more properties to our flood warning service- we‚Äôre also adding over 200 telemetry sites producing 137m new data points a year - hydrometric data heaven! https://t.co/9BZWrfgx8U

Obstructions that restrict the flow of a river, like these shopping trolleys in the Pendle area, can increase flood risk

Our Field Teams work 24/7 to keep our watercourses free of blockages. They are prepared for #flooding, are you?

üëâhttps://t.co/CFSTzxnzju
 
#FloodActionWeek https://t.co/CjKnjaiOE0

It might be the last day of Flood Awareness Week but @EnvAgencyNW and #partners will continue to work with #communities  to improve flood resilience in a changing climate - take a moment to find out what you can do https://t.co/umVOgY79T1 https://t.co/cdVweuJHHt

A pair of beavers on @spainshall Estate have built over a dozen dams, holding up over a million gallons of water as a nature-based solution to flood management.

Manager and owner @arugglesbrise tells us more in this video üëá

#TogetherForOurPlanet | #COP26Ambition |@37squadron https://t.co/oFfRO6lTLL
